alert.note: Alert for Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 17 at 6:02AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Southern Cook county. * WHEN...Until 900 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 559 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Isolated amounts of 1 to 2 inches of rain have already fallen across advisory area. Additional localized rainfall amounts of up to an inch are likely. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chicago, Cicero, Hammond, Orland Park, Tinley Park, Oak Lawn, Berwyn, Calumet City, Chicago Lawn, Roseland, Midway Airport, Englewood, South Lawndale, Bridgeport, South Shore, Burbank, Lansing, Oak Forest, Harvey and Homer Glen. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
